text: Craig Ogden is an Australian classical guitarist whose albums have topped the UK classical charts. He is Principal Lecturer in Guitar at the Royal Northern College of Music in Manchester, UK.RNCM website. Accessed 7 November 2014 Ogden began playing guitar at the age of seven, and graduated in music from the University of Western Australia.Leicester International Music Festival . Accessed 7 November 2014 In 1990 he became UK-based, and has a Professional Performance Diploma from the Royal Northern College of Music, where in 2004 he received a Fellowship from the Royal Northern College of Music, becoming the youngest person to be given the honour.Hyperion Records. Accessed 7 November 2014 He married the British singer Claire Bradshaw, with whom he often performs; together they founded the Dean & Chadlington Summer Music Festival in 2007."Craig Ogden: an Aussie abroad", Cotswold Life, 16 December 2013. Accessed 7 November 2014 He made his first appearance at the Royal Albert Hall with the Philharmonia Orchestra performing Rodrigo's Concierto de Aranjuez. ==Albums== *Tippett: The Blue Guitar (1995) *Guitar Meditations (1999) *English Guitar Concertos (2001) *The Guitarist (2010) *Summertime (2011) *A Quiet Thing: Songs for Voice and Guitar (with David Daniels; 2011) *Christmas Time (2013) *Summer Guitar (2014) *Craig Ogden and Friends (2015) *Love's Philosophy (2017) ==References== Category:Australian classical guitarists Category:Australian male guitarists Category:Academics of the Royal Northern College of Music Category:University of Western Australia alumni Category:Australian expatriates in the United Kingdom Category:Musicians from Manchester Category:Living people Category:Year of birth missing (living people)
